During Android courses we had to do a little app as a project, where we can explore restaurants and expand the data we have from the REST API with our experience. The goal was to have an app which works well, where the user can have a profile, get data from the API as mentioned, list it, view it one by one, and store the modifications in a local database. You can learn more about this project on GitHub.

Unfortunately the original "OpenTable" API collapsed. So a dummy API which functioned as the original was created using Node.js an SQLite database. The rest API offers the same functionality as the original. The data set is recovered from a Room Database which served as a local cache. Sadly this collection is smaller then the original and there may be some smaller bugs here and there. The code and the data is available on GitHub, go check it out.

As mentioned earlier the original api collapsed and became unusable but fortunately the development team at I\'M OK (cool guys by the way üòÅ) allowed us to upload our dummy api to one of their dev servers. This way was reachable 24/7 during the development of the application. Feel free to visit their WebSite to learn more about them and their projects.
